data.question_title: What types of seeds do you sell?
data.question_answer: We offer a wide variety of seeds, including vegetable seeds, flower seeds, herb seeds, fruit seeds, and organic/non-GMO options.
Yes, we provide non-GMO seeds. Each product label or description clearly mentions whether it is non-GMO or certified organic.
Yes, we ship seeds to many countries. However, shipping depends on local import regulations. Please check your country's customs policy before placing an order.

data.question_title: How should I store seeds if I’m not planting them immediately?
data.question_answer: Store seeds in a cool, dry place away from sunlight. Airtight containers or zip-lock bags in a refrigerator or dark cabinet work best.

data.question_title: What is the shelf life of your seeds?
data.question_answer: Most seeds remain viable for 1–3 years if stored properly. Some seeds (like onions) may have a shorter life, while others (like tomatoes or beans) can last longer.
Yes. We follow strict quality testing. If your seeds fail to germinate under proper conditions, please contact us for a replacement or refund.

data.question_title: When is the best time to plant your seeds?
data.question_answer: This depends on the seed variety and your location. We include recommended planting seasons and zones on each seed packet.

data.question_title: Do you offer bulk seed orders for farms or retailers?
data.question_answer: Yes, we offer wholesale and bulk pricing. Please contact our sales team for a custom quote.

data.question_title: How do I know which seeds are best for my region?
data.question_answer: You can use our online planting zone guide or contact us with your location — we’re happy to recommend suitable varieties.
Due to quality control and storage standards, we generally do not accept returns on seeds. However, if there’s a problem with your order, contact us and we’ll make it right.
